title: After successful first launch, Firefly sets sight on national security market
summary: After winning a $17.6 million Space Force contract for a 2023 mission, Firefly eyes more opportunities in the military market

title: After a three-year wait, SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy could launch again later this month
summary: More than three years after SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket last blazed a path into orbit, the 28-engine launcher is finally set to fly again as soon as Oct. 28 from Kennedy Space Center in Florida on a long-delayed national security mission for the U.S. Space Force, a military spokesperson said.

title: SpaceX says 5G plan could disrupt Starlink more than previously thought
summary: Plans to use a part of Ku-band for 5G networks in the United States could disrupt Starlink broadband services even more than SpaceX previously estimated, the company said Oct. 4 as it released interference analysis from a third party.

title: On the ground in Ukraine using Starlink to stay connected
summary: Starlink is helping many people in Ukraine, including a friend of mine who is on the ground helping to train the military. Gia...

title: NASA Invites Media to Learn About Inflatable Heat Shield Demo
summary: NASA and United Launch Alliance (ULA) will host a media briefing on Tuesday, Oct. 11, at 1 p.m. EDT in advance of the Low-Earth Orbit Flight Test of an Inflatable Decelerator (LOFTID) technology demonstration. The briefing will be held via WebEx.
